column1: Cantaloupe—Average retail price per pound and per cup equivalent, 2016

1The USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR) reports that inedible rind, cavity contents, and cutting loss account for 49 percent of the fruit's weight, implying a preparation yield of 51 percent, when the fruit is eaten raw.

Source: Calculated by USDA, Economic Research Service, from 2016 IRI Infoscan data; the USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR), Release 26; and the Food Patterns Equivalents Database (FPED) 2013-14 as well as the FPED's accompanying Methodology and User Guide.
